intro: Conopodium polygamum, commonly known as the common sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in umbels. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of forests. Conopodium polygamum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for various health purposes.
